page.title: 09LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Great Old Hay This name is believed to have been derived from the word haeg meaning hedges Old Hay as it is now called was known as Haya in 1226 and at one time covered 275 acres Castle Hill This was an iron field developed by the Romans who built roads to serve it besides maintaining and improving a number of the earlier prehistoric tracks Castle Hill Camp which is the ruin at the rear of the Castle Public House was constructed to guard the approach to the Tonbridge fords on an important track Castle Hill normally denotes an old or ancient camp site
